docs.lead_paragraph: In February, we noted an eBay auction for a Tony Award won by the costume designer Florence Klotz for her work on the 1985 musical "Grind." Now another Broadway veteran is putting her Tony on the auction block -- along with much, much more.

headline.main: So It's Come to This: Another Tony Award for Sale

docs.abstract: Another Broadway veteran is putting her Tony on the auction block - along with much, much more.
docs.snippet: Another Broadway veteran is putting her Tony on the auction block - along with much, much more.

docs.lead_paragraph: Faced with the looming prospect of a bankruptcy filing by General Motors, the government here narrowed the field of potential buyers of Opel and the rest of G.M.'s European operations to two companies - Magna and Fiat - but failed to agree on a crucial bridge loan to keep Opel afloat.

headline.main: Germany Culls Field of Buyers for G.M.'s European Unit

docs.abstract: Faced with the looming prospect of a bankruptcy filing by General Motors, the government here narrowed the field of potential buyers of Opel and the rest of G.M.'s European operations to two companies, Magna and Fiat --- but failed to agree on a crucial bridge loan to keep Opel afloat.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite signs that the nation's biggest banks are stabilizing, a growing number of small and midsize institutions are coming under stress as the recession wears on, The New York Times's Graham Bowley reported.

headline.main: More Banks Under Stress as Recession Wears On

docs.abstract: The F.D.I.C. said Wednesday that it had placed 305 banks on its list of "problem" institutions, the most since 1994, and up from 252 at the end of 2008.
docs.snippet: The F.D.I.C. said Wednesday that it had placed 305 banks on its list of "problem" institutions, the most since 1994, and up from 252 at the end of 2008.
